wikipedia_page.main: Oliver Bruce Linton is a Professor of Political Economy and Econometrics at Cambridge University and a Fellow of Trinity College. He is a Fellow of the British Academy, a Fellow of the Econometric Society, and a Fellow of the Institute of Mathematical Statistics.Linton is an Associate Editor with Econometrica, a co-editor at Econometric Theory, and a joint editor of Royal Economic Society (RES) Econometrics Journal.

response: From 2010-2012 Cliff was a member of the 8-person core Lead Expert Group (LEG) which led the UK Government's Government Office for Science two-year investigation into The Future of Computer Trading in Financial Markets. In addition to Cliff, the other members of the LEG were Philip Bond, Clara Furse, Charles Goodhart, Andy Haldane, Kevin Houstoun, Oliver Linton, and Jean-Pierre Zigrand, co-Director of the Systemic Risk Centre. The investigation commissioned large volumes of peer-reviewed research from international experts, all of which was published by the Government Office for Science and which is summarised in the project's extensive final report.https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/future-of-computer-trading-in-financial-markets-an-international-perspective UK Government Office for Science Final Report on The Future of Computer Trading in Financial Markets, November 2012.
